intro: Streblacanthus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian streblacanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, dry climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Streblacanthus boliviensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
